===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|p}}: stylized depiction of the human eye, rotated 90 degrees. Compare the {{etyl|egy|-}} hieroglyph {{m|egy|𓁹}}.

===Etymology===
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-mjak ~ s-mik}}. Cognate with {{cog|bo|མིག||eye}}, {{cog|my|မျက်||eye, face}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|yomi=k}}
{{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ま}}. Older, unbound form of {{m|ja|目|tr=me<sub>2</sub>}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|見る|tr=miru||to see}}. Never found in isolation in modern Japanese. Remains as the first syllable of various compounds.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ま}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ま}}

# [[eye]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}

* {{ja-r|瞼|まぶた}}: eyelid
* {{ja-r|瞼|まなぶた}}: eyelid
* {{ja-r|前|まえ}}
* {{ja-r|瞬く|またたく}}: to blink, to wink
* {{ja-r|瞬く|まばたく}}: to blink, to wink
* {{ja-r|瞬ぐ|まじろぐ}}: to blink, to wink
* {{ja-r|眼|まなこ}}: eyeball
* {{ja-r|眦|まなじり}}: corner of the eye
{{der-mid}}

* {{ja-r|眉|まゆ}}: eyebrow
* {{ja-r|眼差し|まなざし}}: a look, gaze
* {{ja-r|血眼|ちまなこ}}: bloodshot eyes

* {{ja-r|団栗眼|どんぐり まなこ}}: goggle-eyes (acorn-eyes)

{{der-bottom}}

{{ja-kanjitab|め|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/me<sub>2</sub>/ *[məj] → /me/ [me]}}. Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=め|目|tr1=ma|pos1=unbound form|い|tr2=i|pos2=emphatic nominal particle}}. Now the modern Japanese term for {{m|en|eye}}.

* {{ja-r|目算|もくさん}}: [[eyeball]]ing something, making a visual estimate or calculation of something

* {{ja-r|目録|もくろく}}: a [[list]], a [[catalog]]
